title: Oxford University A.F.C.
text:
Oxford University Association Football Club is an <a href="England">English</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> club representing the <a href="University%20of%20Oxford">University of Oxford</a>. The club currently plays in the <a href="BUCS%20Football%20League">BUCS Football League</a>, the league system of <a href="British%20Universities%20and%20Colleges%20Sport">British Universities and Colleges Sport</a> (BUCS). In 2020, the club merged with Oxford University Women's Association Football Club (OUWAFC) to create one single entity.
Oxford University was one of the earliest winners of the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a>, having achieved it in <a href="1874%20FA%20Cup%20Final">1874</a> after beating the <a href="Royal%20Engineers%20A.F.C.">Royal Engineers</a>.
History.
Formed on 9 November 1871, the club was a giant of the 1870s, winning the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> 2–0 against <a href="Royal%20Engineers%20A.F.C.">Royal Engineers</a> in <a href="FA%20Cup%20Final%201874">1874</a> and finishing the competition as runners-up in <a href="FA%20Cup%20Final%201873">1873</a>, <a href="FA%20Cup%20Final%201877">1877</a> and <a href="FA%20Cup%20Final%201880">1880</a>, the last year they competed. The club merged with <a href="OUWAFC">OUWAFC</a>, the women's club, in 2020.
The club left the <a href="Iffley%20Road%20rugby%20football%20ground">Iffley Road rugby football ground</a>, which it shared with <a href="Oxford%20University%20Rugby%20Football%20Club">Oxford University Rugby Football Club</a>, in 1921 and moved to the nearby <a href="Iffley%20Road%20Stadium">Iffley Road Stadium</a>.
The club <a href="Pegasus%20A.F.C.">Pegasus</a> of the 1950s was formed from the Oxford and <a href="Cambridge%20University%20A.F.C.">Cambridge University</a> teams.
OUAFC has competed in the British University and College Sports (BUCS) leagues as well as contesting the annual Varsity Football Match against Cambridge University. In 2016, it has seen play Arnaud Trébaol, former player of <a href="Royal%20Excel%20Mouscron">Royal Excel Mouscron</a>, former Financial Stability Expert at the <a href="European%20Central%20Bank">European Central Bank</a>, and current Economist at <a href="Banque%20de%20France">Banque de France</a>.
International players.
England.
Twenty-nine Oxford players were capped for <a href="England%20national%20football%20team">England</a>, including three of the team which took part in the <a href="1872%20Scotland%20v%20England%20football%20match">first international match</a> on 30 November 1872: <a href="Frederick%20Chappell">Frederick Chappell</a>, <a href="Arnold%20Kirke-Smith">Arnold Kirke-Smith</a> and <a href="Cuthbert%20Ottaway">Cuthbert Ottaway</a>.
